result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:00 AM Defendant David Briant Thompson in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for David Briant Thompson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen notes that he was recently appointed to case. Asks for a trial date in January. Notes they will continue to work towards a resolution in the matter. Attorney Nelsen notes defendant has not been interested in previous offers given. State is in agreement.
Jury trial scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:31 AM Defendant David Briant Thompson in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes that Rosenthal agreed to take the case after the PD's office attempted to contact 315 lawyers to take the case. Court notes that there is a request for a speedy trial. Attorney Rosenthal notes that the request will be withdrawn. Asks for another status in 30 days. Defendant is agreeable to withdrawing request.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:09 AM Defendant David Briant Thompson in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for David Briant Thompson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status. Court accepts not guilty pleas.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:16 AM Defendant David Briant Thompson in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for David Briant Thompson.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
public defender order appointing counsel

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Briant Thompson appeared by video, in custody. 
Court questions attorney status
Defendant- no attorney yet
Court notes he qualifies for Public Defender but they haven't found one yet. Questions defendant's wishes on prelim
Defendant- Wants to waive time limits and get attorney
 Court sets new date for prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Attorney Appointment Status
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:30 PM Defendant David Briant Thompson appeared by video with Attorney Ryan Reid.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. Not guilty plea(s) entered. 
State requesting 10,000cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
class d felony repeater, felony probation warrant out of stloco pending extradition.  lengthy history dating back to 1989. multiple fta's, probation violations, prison time. Federal conviction.  unsure of specific local ties
Attorney Reid-superior residence for about 6 years, prior to that address lived in superior. some family that lives in superior/douglas county area.  requesting 3000cb
Court-Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties and concerns. Substantial prior criminal hist, and fta's.
Court Orders 10,000cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.
